thread.title: How to Tell if Students Are Making the Grade

author: wsjcom
title: How to Tell if Students Are Making the Grade
text: It is difficult to understand how Jennifer C. Braceras could argue that a single letter grade could provide a more “comprehensible and holistic measure of achievement” than a competence-based transcript that maps student achievement onto clear, consistent and detailed standards (“The War on Grades Deserves to Fail,” op-ed, Jan. 30). Nor is her claim that only traditional letter grades can take into account “effort, ability to meet deadlines, or level of engagement” very persuasive. Students who meet rigorous academic standards in a competence-based system don’t do so by happenstance. They must work just as hard, responsibly...
